channel.title: New homepage
channel.description:
Thoughts?
[url=https://www.runescape.com]www.runescape.com[/url]
I honestly like it and think that the hot topics for the forums feature and quick polls are great. Also the Explore RuneScape feature at the bottom of the page saves a lot of time for browsing the site.
Off-topic: I am also satisfied with the new dungeoneering rewards, especially the new bone necklaces: [url=https://www.runescape.com/kbase/guid/dungeoneering_rewards#bone_necklace]https://www.runescape.com/kbase/guid/dungeoneering_rewards#bone_necklace[/url]

item.title: New homepage
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:9, topic:367103”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=463292.msg3390910#msg3390910 date=1288911628]

Or just don’t be bad and install a browser extension that removes the referrer when you cross sites.

P. sure that breaks a lot of shit on some baddie websites…

So if I open a new tab and, without navigating anywhere, go to the baddie website, it will break? That is their problem not mine.

It could if they just assume a referer will always be there. It would be their fault though.

Blocking all referer’s would make you unable to vote on the moparscape server status page, though.
[/quote]Why would any website even consider assuming a referrer is always present…[/quote]

I don’t know, why do some websites assume everyone in the world uses Internet Explorer 6? Some do.

Read full topic

item.title: New homepage
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Hence why I said

Unhandled:

when you cross sites

Or just don’t be bad and install a browser extension that removes the referrer when you cross sites.

P. sure that breaks a lot of shit on some baddie websites…

So if I open a new tab and, without navigating anywhere, go to the baddie website, it will break? That is their problem not mine.

It could if they just assume a referer will always be there. It would be their fault though.

Blocking all referer’s would make you unable to vote on the moparscape server status page, though.
[/quote]Why would any website even consider assuming a referrer is always present…[/quote]

when logging into certain things they might check the referrer and if its not correct, then you must be a bot.

Read full topic

item.title: New homepage
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

Moparisthebest:

I feel I post this in every thread, but if you aren’t using HTTPS here, and click on any of those links, then runescape will have logs that your IP visited from here.

yay for uni ip
oh wait i dont even play rs…
